intro: Hieracium pannosum subsp. friwaldii, commonly known as the Friwald's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its subspecies status reflects distinct morphological and genetic differences from other Hieracium species. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
